data.title: Rupert Reynolds-MacLean on LinkedIn: Nails
data.meta_description:
Another in the series of films we've just made for Uber Eats and Mother London. Directed by Andreas Nilsson.
The campaign focusses on slowing down and do less.‚Ä¶
data.text:
Uber Eats #superbowl 2024 TVC is easily one of my favourites üòÇüòÇ David and Jennifer's "Like I could forget 10 years of my life!" is hilarious... And Beckham and Posh Spice's, "Paprika gal?" is downright funny. This is such a great time of the year for creativity. Excellent (and sometimes terrible!) films for sure. But also some of the activations (Doritos on the Luxor!), and moment marketing (2023 Carters Inc. billboard!). Let the action begin ü•Åü•Åü•Å #advertisingandmarketing #brandbuilding #

I have ‚Äúmy‚Äù table in a few bars and restaurants. When that table is taken by someone else, I feel robbed just as I would if someone stole an actual, legal possession of mine. Ever had that feeling? On the other hand, I feel absolutely no attachment to the Uber car I rode in yesterday. I barely remember it. So why do you feel attached to your Spotify history and your social media profiles but not to the Uber cars you ride in? It's called psychological ownership and it is the key to client retention and loyalty. Spotify and EasyJet do this extremely well. More examples here + the guide on how to build psychological ownership into your own offers: https://lnkd.in/dDF-375S #strategy #marketing #marketingstrategy

This is definitely an exciting method to test both a technical and marketing innovation. Granted, there are many aspects to this that just won‚Äôt allow it for an operational business model in pizza delivery at this time, but it does afford some key insights. * can the tech be refined for safety, environmental friendliness, and operational ROI. * could this concept be applicable to either business or societal issues where time is of the essence and the operational cost is acceptable. * what can be done to make the jet pack idea improved for safety? Segway arrived at key safety features for its Segway machines, can this jetback become more innovative. * do humans actually need to be in the jet pack? Why not humanoid robots, which could offer more potential of what item/expertise is delivered. The only way to truly innovate is to try something, sometimes that innovation is not understand by the masses on the first go, but it is needed to refine the bigger picture or even determine that a concept may need shelved. #innovation #techadvancements #frontiertech #emergingtech #flybyjetpack #dominospizza

It sounds like you're looking to build and grow your insurance agency effectively! Here's a breakdown of how to approach each aspect you mentioned: 1. **Leads**: Focus on lead generation strategies such as digital marketing (SEO, PPC, social media), networking events, partnerships with local businesses, and referrals. 2. **CRM (Customer Relationship Management)**: Choose a CRM system that suits your needs for managing client interactions, automating workflows, and tracking leads. Popular options include Salesforce, HubSpot, and Zoho CRM. 3. **Dialer**: Implement a dialer system that integrates with your CRM for efficient outbound calling. Look into tools like Five9, CallTools, or Dialpad. 4. **Agents**: Recruit and train agents who align with your agency's values and goals. Provide ongoing coaching and development to ensure they stay motivated and productive. 5. **Training**: Offer regular training sessions covering product knowledge, sales techniques, customer service skills, and use of CRM and dialer systems. 6. **Materials**: Develop marketing materials, presentations, and sales scripts that agents can use to effectively communicate with prospects and clients. 7. **Support**: Provide ongoing support to your agents through mentoring, team meetings, and access to resources such as FAQs, knowledge bases, and help desks. 8. **Resources**: Invest in technology and tools that streamline operations and enhance customer experience, such as online quoting systems, e-signature solutions, and customer portals. Partnering with experts or consultants in the insurance industry can indeed accelerate your agency's growth. They can provide insights, strategies, and best practices based on their experience. If you have specific questions or need further guidance on any of these aspects, feel free to ask!
